definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: They towed the van to the church parking lot for safekeeping.
sentences.chinese: 他們把箱型車拖到教會的停車場保管。

sentences.english: I parked in the lot at Central High.
sentences.chinese: 我把車停在了中央高中的停車場。

sentences.english: Many cars lay jostling each other at the parking lot.
sentences.chinese: 許多汽車在停車場上緊緊挨在一起。
可接納50人左右團隊，自備停車場。

sentences.english: It's on your left. It's next to the parking lot.
sentences.chinese: 威克牛排酒家在你的左手邊，緊挨着停車場。

sentences.english: Her car was still in the parking lot.
Dongfang Square is next to the park.
sentences.chinese: 東方廣場在停車場的旁邊。

sentences.english: It has three car-parks, which can hold more than 100 cars.
sentences.chinese: 擁有停車場三個，可停放100輛汽車。

sentences.english: He pointed to a bright red sleekly gleaming Ferrari in the parking lot.
sentences.chinese: 他指着停車場上閃亮的，線條優美的紅色法拉利說道。

sentences.english: Elaine is talking to the manager of the parking lot, Mark.
sentences.chinese: 伊蓮正對停車場管理員馬克說話。

sentences.english: This space was prepared for building a multi-story car park.
sentences.chinese: 這個空地是爲建立一個多層停車場準備的。

sentences.english: However, the food options were outrageously expensive and the parking was a rip-off .
sentences.chinese: 但是實物價格高的讓人氣憤，停車場簡直就是搶錢。

sentences.english: Tennis hall and outdoor courts in the hotel park.
sentences.chinese: 網球館和室外球場在酒店停車場。

sentences.english: We needed the space on the carport.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要在空間上的停車場。

sentences.english: You should wash the car park with effluent water.
sentences.chinese: 你應該用排出來的水洗停車場。

sentences.english: He's irritated with cashiers. Tim honks at people and cars in parking lots and on the streets.
sentences.chinese: 在停車場會對着前面的行人和汽車不停按喇叭。

definition: to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
parking spot/unloading point/garage place/stand for taxi
shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
to access/to transfer passengers between two railway lines
as the time draws near/at the last moment/temporary/interim/ad hoc
